Reviews.Title: “lovely room, friendly staff, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: spangey78
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 weeks as a family, the staff were REALLY friendly, especially the concierge and the restaurant staff, great facilities for kids, theres a kids zone, arcade, football area etc, and lovely pool

Reviews.Title: “Customer servce to applaud”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel, with excellent and friendly staff, and a well-considered approach to assisting customers. Price was also very keen and good value for money. Booking was easy - no problems and instantly confirmed. What an excellent welcome to the hotel, Singapore and the taxi driver. My personal thanks for a great stay. You will never know how grateful we were for your assistance in helping us with our needs. Your staff were magnificent (and the rest of the stay was too).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: calmtravel56
Reviews.Content: Was amazed at how fantastic the service was and how helpful the staff were. I also found the rooms very pleasant, the breakfast that was included was enjoyable. The pool and gym are fantastic. We had a greaat experience the only down side is the place is not that cheap but other equivalent hotels (in Singapore) aren't either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but slightly expensive”
Reviews.Author: amitgupta_08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fraser Suites Singapore for more than a month during April/May 2011. This was a business trip and mainly chose Fraser due to its top class reputation in the service apartments sector. Spacious apartments with well done rooms. The staff and house keeping were very warm and welcoming and always ready to help. When compared with the other service apartments in the area, Fraser turns out to be slightly expensive, more because of its newly renovated swimming pool and gym area. Decent spread for the breakfast buffet and free daily shuttle services to Orchard Road and other shopping malls. One disadvantage is that they dont have a Memembership Program like most other hotels and are neither affliated with Starwood or similar programs. Needless to say that this would deter me from coming back to them. Ideal place for families and individuals who prefer to cook. The management also organizes events on a monthly basis - such as Singapore Zoo Visit, Bird Park Visit etc at very reasonable prices (cheaper than what you would pay at the ticket counter) and even includes pick-up and drop to the hotel. It is also conveniently located, within 10 minutes by cab from the CBD and Orchard Road areas. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to begin your relocation to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: typebug
Reviews.Content: I have to say after doing a few international relocation I've seen my share of extended stay apartments. Given that this was 4X what these suites generally cost I expected a spacious room and comfortable bed. When we walked in upon arrival we both burst out laughing. It was smaller than the hotel room we'd previously had downtown. The bed we affectionately referred to as "the plank." The kitchen is pretty average for Singapore. Rage top, sketchy convection oven/microwave combo and poor quality pots and utensils. I did note they used Wedgewood for the tea service. The furniture was an odd mish mash of Ikea, and faux Perkanan/Victorian. There was no dinner table, but then again who cooks here? It's Singapore. The pool area of beautiful, the gym is quite nice and all the staff were professional. We took advantage of the shuttle service and sometimes did the free breakfast downstairs. Compared to the Fraser Place location (where our friends were stationed at the same time) this location is really family oriented. There's nothing much to do within walking distance and we soon tired of the few local restaurants. As a wife staying here with a husband working I'd have preferred to be in the Fraser Place location as this was a bit too isolating. I would recommend it if you have kids under 5 and want to stick close to home and meet other moms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Welcome to Singapore for Families with Kids”
Reviews.Author: rle99
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Fraser Suites serviced apartments in Singapore (on River Valley Road) for the first month of our expat assignment in Singapore. I wanted to write a review particularly for families with small children. This is a great place for kids. It has an indoor "Play Zone" that is huge. Repeat: it is indoor! We took the children to the play zone at least twice a day. It is large, clean, and very well maintained. There is also an outdoor area with plenty of toys and an old sc hool video game room, which was great. The other highlight is the service. The staff at the front desk and housekeeping were great; but the cafe staff were exceptional. This is in a wonderful central location. It is connected to a mall with a Cold Storage grocery store and a Starbucks. Extremely convenient. Fraser runs many free private bus shuttles throughout the day -- to the business district morning/evening and to major shopping areas all day. We stayed in a two bedroom suite that had recently been updated. It was very modern, very nice. I am not sure that all of the rooms are renovated. I recommend you inquire about this when booking. This would be my only concern. The free breakfast, pool, gym, business center and other amenities were great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and staff”
Reviews.Author: singabob
Reviews.Content: Let's get something straight: Fraser Suites has three separate properties in Singapore and has nothing to do with 'Great World' that the previous reviewer wrote about. The River Valley location is part of Valley Point Shopping Center. I have stayed with Frasers on numerous occasions for extended periods of time. They are a 'service apartment' hotel (for extended stays) and really don't court the nightly or a couple of nights market. This is also the tropics, so there are geckos (harmless, frightened lizards that eat insects) at times on the walls or ceilings (depending on your luck). The old-fashioned furniture mentioned in other reviews is the Peranakan style, or Straits Chinese (and Malay) style, which is being phased out for ultra-modern chrome and glass decor, sadly. It's a shame people come with such ignorances. Bottom line: the place is super clean, quiet, and with a ultra-friendly staff that will bend over backwards for you. The location is ideal for just about anything in Singapore and free transportation to major areas is provided. Five bus lines run outside the front door and cheap taxis are plentiful. The property is surrounded by shopping, local neighborhoods and a variety of nice restaurants to fit any taste or budget. If you aren't satisfied here, you can't be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: GoldenDragon338
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay for families with children. Welcome was very warm and friendly. We were given a welcome hamper and the children each received a soft toy. This was totally unexpected and a very pleasant surprise as we had just got in after midnight. There is free scheduled shuttle bus to popular shopping areas so access will not be an issue. Full cooking facility if you need one. However close by are many restaurants catering for all taste. A convenient store is also located in the same area. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NOISY, don't stay here if you NEED peace & tranquility!!”
Reviews.Author: geojak0
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom suite is comfy enough & average for this type of long stay suite, however the kitchenette is not equipped fully. So if you're staying for any length of time bring extra pans coz they provide only 2 small stove top pots & no frying pans or colander (buying them at the local supermarket is mega bucks). Only the 3 bedroom appt has an oven, the 2 bed only a stove top. Local restaurants are so so & very expensive...lots of microwaved foods sold at wine bars for example. My biggest problem with this locale is that it shares the same block as a night club, so on Wednesday we were woken up at 11:30pm by extremely loud Acid House music & even louder DJ; all the windows closed & despite being on the 5th floor we could still feel the shock waves rattling the bathroom windows & floors!! I have yet to experience Thursday night, but expect more of the same. Friday thru Sun there was a live band outside in the square below our window which played till 10pm & our 3 & 5 year olds couldn't hear the tv in front of us on full volume. The only evenings that were peaceful were Monday & Tuesday. The only nights our kids got to sleep undisturbed & by 8pm were Monday & Tuesday. This is not the place to stay if you are visiting Singapore on Medical Tourism, have had an operation (as in our case) & are waiting out the week post op for the docs consultation. It is hell to stay here with the noise & disturbance if you have young kids & need peace & quiet to recoup after surgery. Staff are nice, pool so so (could see nicer outdoor facilities at neighboring hotels from our window), can't say how breakfast was as we ate in our suite. That said, if you want rowdy night life & so so restaurants & a place not to far from anything then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: SoudsinPhilly
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay here by my husband's Singapore office employee, and it payed off. We joined him on his nearly two week business trip, with our two small children (3 yrs and 1 yrs). The free Singapre Zoo family pass we got to use was also great value: my kids (and we too) enjoyed the new water feature and spent most of time there keeping cool. The Suites staff were very patient with our kids, even in their cafe when my toddler had moments of extreme energy. We loved the size of the apartments (although I wuld have preferred a computer to have been provided in the 2-bedroom units just like in the one-bedroom ones - and I think they should provide internet service just like in the Kids Zone and their Library), where we didn't feel our kids were a problem to other guests and they could enjoy the comforts of home (high chair and baby crib provided, even a bed guard rail if my toddler needed it!). The cafe was a mostly miss for their weekday breakfasts (Mondays were the best, I thought; and bring your backpack and stow away some kiddy yogurts to put in your fridge for quick snacks later). The in-hotel spa was disappointing too (VERY hard sell when all you just want is a chance to relax; I liked their facial, although it wasn't clear from the description that that is all I would be really getting - free foot spa was really just dunking your feet in one of those home-style foot spa auto baths, and then getting a very quick hand rub of your toes), The kids' swimming pool was great - and during the weekdays mornings when we went to the pool, the jacuzzi pool was never used and was an ideal pool for the kids to splash in and swim around. Loads of floaty toys provided and a cute Little Tykes type water slide too. The indoor play Kids Zone was ok, but my toddler lost interest quickly in it, and if there were older kids about, the place was often in a huge mess with big kids bolting about. The Housekeeping staff were very kind and they often did double duty by offering baby sitting services when they are off cleaning duty (Ru was great - she spoke clear English and understood our toddler without batting an eye lash). The outdoor playground on the same level as the play zone, was often water logged (fake grassy turf over old concrete), but my kids liked the swings there. There is a nice playground in the condo complex next to the Suites that you can easy walk to and that has shade (mornings are best, as it's cooler and more kids are about). There's also a good hawker place for local food and cheep prices down by the river and across from Great World City Mall. As part of the Suites building, there's a Cold Storage grocery store, which was really convenient. And I liked my hair cut at the hair salon as part of that mall, and the breakfast was good at little cafe that serves Kaya Toast breakfast. Overall, if traveling with kids, I think it's a great value and I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “City appartments”
Reviews.Author: vastgotta
Reviews.Content: What to say about a short term stay appartment. Its a friendly place, clean, public transport at its doorsteps, a Starbucks in the building and a friendly staff. If you stay here, dont stay too long.. This place doesnt have a 'soul' and is very mainstream with the decoration of its rooms.. which I guess is a good thing for an appartment hotel, catering for a global community. There is also a free breakfast buffet every morning (weekdays) The pool is big and very quiet in the weeks I have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Just average...”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a month and the experience was just average. The staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast is okay on certain days (no breakfast on the weekends and public holidays), and the decor in the room is old fashioned (really needs a makeover!). The carpet and the couch in the living room has stains (slightly gray with marker and drink stains) on them. The pillows in the bedroom was a little on the flat side but the plus side is that the housekeeping staff changed the sheets every alternate days. The bathroom too is in need of a makeover (garish lighting - not very inviting) and the towels (changed every day) were a little thin and rough on the skin. There was no oven in our unit but the kitchen served its purpose. There is a microwave, fridge, toaster, electric kettle and a stove. Cutlery and dishes are provided. There is a washer and dryer in the unit on the outside balcony. On the 6th floor, there is the pool and the gym - they are quite okay and can be quite busy on weekends and the evenings! You can order food from the cafeteria if you want but there are other options (e.g. the Red Palms Cafe and Cafe in Action or even Cold Storage at the Valley Point Mall next door and there are restaurants on the way to Great World City mall which is a less than 10 minute walk away). Finally, the two shuttle runs are not too bad - Orchard Road and Suntec City run. Depending on the traffic, they can be on time. The drivers are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirlMalaysia
Reviews.Content: I have just spend two months at the fraser suites.I found the decor a bit old fashioned but the apartment was kept spotless by the housekeeping staff. At no time did we have any unwanted beasties, The breakfast in the morning was a bonus and the kitchen staff always friendly, Two shuttle buses ferried you to different parts of the town and was great for finding your way about Singapore shopping hotspots. Very good for children as it had play area and childrens pools,Acomputer room with reading library.and a gym.Allin all i enjoyed my stay there and the staff always had time to talk to you.

Reviews.Title: “Fraser is great for kids”
Reviews.Author: Cheech-and-Sean
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent three months staying at Fraser Suites waiting for the birth of our second child. During that time we stayed in three different apartments -- each one bigger than the last -- as we needed space first for our mother-in-law and then for relatives and the baby. Because we work and live in Asia, this wasn't our first extended stay in Singapore but it was our first time with Fraser. We definitely plan to return. Here are the things we liked: -- Kidstuff: the huge, well-stocked indoor playground/play room for kids was a hit with our three year old. (we checked out several places and this was by far the best kids area we could find.) -- Outdoor areas: the swimming pool/barbecue area is well designed so that there are both semi-private areas and places to hang out an meet your neighbors. The kids pool is separate from the adult pool, meaning I could swim laps without having to dodge children. -- Service: service was efficient and very pleasant. My wife liked our maid so much that she asked if she could continue servicing our apartment even after we moved to a completely different floor. -- Convenience: a small shopping mall with a grocery store (and an excellent Italian restaurant) is attached to the apartment building. We loved being able to run out to the grocery store and be back in the apartment in less than 10 minutes. -- Shuttle service: the apartment runs a couple of shuttles throughout the day to most of the prime shopping and tourist destinations (orchard road and Suntec). Taking the shuttle was usually more convenient and easier than taking a taxi. -- Internet service: our room came with free, extremely speedy, internet service. I don't know if other rooms have that or not. The things we didn't like so much: -- Breakfast: Fraser has free breakfast during the week. It appeared popular, but the menu didn't really suit my family. -- Location: the apartment isn't located near a subway stop so you have to take the shuttle or a taxi if you plan to ride it. The area is also quite residential, so you have to take a taxi to go to the main shopping and eating districts. -- Ovens: my wife and I love to cook. The ovens are complex and not intuitive. I don't know how many batches of cookies we ruined before we figured out how to use them properly. You can see a few pictures of the apartment (and the new baby) at www.samsphotoshelf.blogspot.com. Go way back to the beginning of the blog. Pictures of the pool and play area can be seen at www.dailyalec.blogspot.com (go to the archives from September).

Reviews.Title: “It's about average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fraser Suites for 2 months and found it distinctly average. The staff are nice enough, but then again this is Singapore, where service is always excellent. I had no problems with unwanted house guests, such as lizards, but I did have a small infestation of green fly, why was quickly dealt with thanks to a can of bug spray (requested from housekeeping). The decor of the room is old, and I didn't get much natural sunlight, which made for a bit of a gloomy room. Housekeeping are ok, not great, not bad ... just ok. They kept my apartment clean enough, but don't expect to engage them in conversation as their English is not the best. So if you have any special requests, speak to the front desk. The gym has one decent treadmil, (3 in total), which can be difficult to get to use if you go at peak times - but it does have quite a broad collection of machines, which probably rivals anything you'd get elsewhere. The shuttle buses are a plus, but yet again, most of the serviced apartments provide this service. The other Fraser serviced apartment, (Robertson Quay), looks to be much better situated, as its next door to Clarke Quay which is a stones throw away from the city. Would I stay here agin? probably not, there are other better options.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying in!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The review from the guy with his wife have to be someone working at Fraser Suites Singapore, cause the place has lazards and ants in the apartments. I stayed one month and requested my comp 400 any never to book there again! Housekeeping isn't that great. The front office staff is nice, top management needs a overhaul; cause their closing their eyes to some major pest and housekeeping issues here! Like the other review said spend your monies else where! Is where I would sum it up too!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Fraser Suites for a month”
Reviews.Author: JetsetterinAsia
Reviews.Content: The last reviewer must have had a unusually bad experience. My wife and I just stayed there for a month during our relocation to Singapore. Would I stay there again?..most definately! Our suite on level 10 was excellent, clean as a whistle. Modern facilities, great kitchen, bathrooms and bedrooms. The gym is on level 6 and is of a higher standard than most modern hotels. The business centre with 4 free internet PC's is excellent - kept my wife in touch with her friends. The pool is excellent. The staff were very friendly, although the houskeepers have a habit of knocking once and then walking in to service your room. We didn't have any lizards in our room, although we were on the tenth floor. They would more than likely be gekkos anyway, small friendly things about the size of your finger and found all over the tropics. They provide free continental breakfast in the poolside restaurant each morning until 10:00am...my wife loved it. A free Fraser shopper shuttle also runs every two hours to Orchard Road and Suntec Centre. It is in the same complex as Valley Point mall, where you have at your disposal a; Cold Storage (Supermarket), Hair salon, Pharmacy(Drug Store), DVD/Video Rental, Italian Restaurant, Starbucks, Photo Lab, Wine Cellar...everything your need. It's about 5 mins taxi ride to Orchard Road and about 10 mins to the city. Much better than a hotel if you are staying for an extended time. We are used to 5/6 star hotels, like The Fullerton, Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons and we loved Fraser Suites.

HotelInfo.Name: Fraser Suites River Valley Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 491 River Valley Road, Singapore 248372, Singapore
